page.title: 12WYNDHAM/WESTERN COLLIERY
page.content: THE WYNDHAM COLLIERY IS SITUATED IN THE OGMORE VALLEY. IT WAS SUNK BY JAMES BROGDEN IN 1868 TO PROVIDE COAL FOR THE TONDU IRON WORKS. THE WESTERN COLLIERY ALSO SITUATED IN THE OGMORE VALLEY (NEAR THE WYNDHAM COLLIERY), WAS SUNK IN 1887 BY THE OCEAN COAL COMPANY. THE SHAFTS SOME 349 YARDS DEEP WERE SUNK TO THE NINE FEET SEAM. THESE TWO PITS WERE LATER OWNED BY DIFFERENT PEOPLE. THE WYNDHAM WAS SOLD IN 1907 TO THE CORY BROTHERS WHO THEN PASSED IT INTO THE POWER DUFFRYN EMPIRE UNTIL NATIONALISATION IN 1947. IN 1972 THE TWO COLLIERIES MERGED TO BECOME WYNDHAM/WESTERN COLLIERY AN IDEA FROM THE N.C.B. THE WYNDHAM/WESTERN COLLIERY WAS CLOSED IN 1983 AND HAS HAD A SERIOUS EFFECT ON THE ECONONY OF THE OGMORE VALLEY.
